item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 8, 2024 at 3:05 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Reverse engineering the Sega Channel game image file format (26 points | discuss)
2. Just: Just a Command Runner (356 points | 224 comments)
3. The largest open-source dataset of car designs, including their aerodynamics (180 points | 69 comments)
4. Show HN: I built an HTML5 RTL-SDR application (27 points | 5 comments)
5. PostgreSQL High Availability Solutions – Part 1: Jepsen Test and Patroni (14 points | 2 comments)
6. Show HN: Countless.dev – A website to compare every AI model: LLMs, TTSs, STTs (249 points | 60 comments)
7. Notre Dame Cathedral reopens (86 points | 31 comments)
8. GroMo (YC W21) Is Hiring ( | hide)
9. Arctic uses a fan to cool another fan (36 points | 20 comments)
10. Hiroshi Nagai: Japan's Sun-Drenched Americana (218 points | 35 comments)
11. Browsing negative content online makes mental health struggles worse: Study (80 points | 50 comments)
12. Historically, 4NF explanations are needlessly confusing (61 points | 15 comments)
13. Landlords Are Using AI to Raise Rents (24 points | 10 comments)
14. Beekeepers halt honey awards over fraud in global supply chain (175 points | 172 comments)
15. My second year without a job (492 points | 752 comments)
16. I algorithmically donated $5000 to Open Source (303 points | 65 comments)
17. My4th Light – Custom 8-Bit Forth CPU (8 points | 1 comment)
18. Ask HN: What's the one feature you'd want in a GitHub productivity tool? (9 points | 27 comments)
19. Biggest shell programs (199 points | 102 comments)
20. Melons and Melancholy: "Eating and Being" illuminates the dynamics of dietetics (11 points | discuss)
21. Lies I was told about collab editing, Part 1: Algorithms for offline editing (284 points | 98 comments)
22. Accessing a DRM Framebuffer to display an image (84 points | 12 comments)
23. Tempest Anderson: Pioneer of Volcano Photography (2015) (19 points | 1 comment)
24. Can life emerge around a white dwarf? (107 points | 76 comments)
25. SpiderBasic (67 points | 31 comments)
26. Deepfakes weaponised to target Pakistan's women leaders (35 points | 10 comments)
27. Claud Cockburn invented guerrilla journalism (34 points | 7 comments)
28. Protecting undersea internet cables is a tech nightmare (109 points | 111 comments)
29. Ultralytics AI model hijacked to infect thousands with cryptominer (73 points | 28 comments)
30. Mathics 7.0 – Open-source alternative to Mathematica (156 points | 32 comments)
